item.title: Introduction to Google Earth Engine with R - I
item.description: addClassKlippyToPreCode(); addClassKlippyTo("pre.r, pre.markdown"); addKlippy('right', 'top', 'auto', '1', 'Click to copy', 'Done'); 1. What is Google Earth Engine ? Google Earth Engine is a computing platform that allows users to run geospatial analysis on Googleâ€™s infrastructure. There are several ways to interact with the platform: Explorer Code Editor Javascript client library Python client library R client library This website is focused on the last one, you can use the R client library to send/receive messages to/from the Earth Engine server and development web applications.
